triples.name: Sharp-P
triples.relevance: The paper addresses the #P-hard weighted model counting problem, grounding it in computational complexity theory.

triples.name: Bayesian network
triples.relevance: Computing marginal probabilities in Bayesian networks is one of the primary applications and evaluation domains for the proposed approach.

triples.name: Marginal distribution
triples.relevance: The paper specifically addresses computing marginal probabilities as a key application of the weighted model counting method.

triples.name: Sampling (statistics)
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a deterministic alternative to existing sampling-based approaches that provide statistical convergence guarantees.

triples.name: Graphical model
triples.relevance: Probabilistic graphs used for reliability estimation are a type of graphical model, representing the second main evaluation domain.

triples.name: Probabilistic logic
triples.relevance: Weighted model counting plays a central role in probabilistic reasoning frameworks based on logic.

triples.name: Limited Discrepancy Search
triples.relevance: The paper proposes using Limited Discrepancy Search as a key technique to make bounds converge faster in their approach.
